title: 28.2 Inverting Matrices
content:
Section 28.2

Inverting Matrices

Summary

Computing A⁻¹ using LUP decomposition.

Key Points

  • To find A⁻¹, solve AX = I for each column of X
  • Use LUP decomposition: solve n systems
  • Time: O(n³) - same as multiplication!
  • Theorem: matrix inversion ≡ matrix multiplication (complexity)
  • In practice, avoid explicit inverse; solve systems directly

Example

To compute A⁻¹, decompose PA = LU once, then solve LUx = Pej for each standard basis vector ej.

Why It Matters

Shows inversion is no harder than multiplication.
